channel.title: I need help (mentally)
channel.description:
Lately I have been feeling very strange (mentally). I am an overall happy person, I have no reason to be sad/depressed whatsoever. It's not so much that I am actually sad, it's more like a placebo of emotion; the more I think of this problem, the more negative I feel. The more nagative I feel, the more I think of the problem. The emotions are not sad, mad, or anything else, they are just...negative. I am a fairly spiritual person, and I am very good at channeling energy. So when I concentrate, I am able to force these emotions out of my being, and pull positive emotions in (sorry if this sounds too hippy-ish). This works, it puts me in a very good mood very fast. However, this lasts for about 10 minutes, and as soon as one minuscule thought of doubt enters my mind, or one small part my consciousness that lacks confidence in the control of these negative emotions becomes appearant, the negative emotions slowly re-enter my consciousness.
This is very aggravating, I have absolutely no reason to be unhappy. My life is great, I have an amazing girlfriend, supporting family, and true friends. It's odd, because when I am with my girlfriend, I never feel these emotions, and everything seems perfect. I know it's all in my head, however the human brain can be easily influenced by "whats in your head", which is why I call it a "placebo of emotions".
The most irritating part of this is it isn't something most people could understand, so I haven't told anyone. So, I've turned here.
Edit: Just posting this has helped. I am trying to keep feelings of doubt from entering my mind.

item.title: I need help (mentally)
item.dc:creator: @killer_jcd killer jcd
item.description:
@killer_jcd wrote:

The Puberty remark isnt really a “smart ass” remark it is actually a reasonable answer. But if you do have these depression problems like you are saying try talking to your school’s guidence program. Or a teacher parent or even a friends parent. Don’t talk to any random friend try talking to a best friend you know a lot. Even though some people seem to be good friends you never know. Your girlfriend might even be a good person to talk to. but if you need to talk to someone ill talk, i have had this problem before. I know that you dont know me andthis might even help. here is my e-mail and aim.

e-mail. jcd1234@msn.com
aim. jcd9213

Read full topic

item.title: I need help (mentally)
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

It’s actually pretty normal to feel depressed for no reason at all as a teenager. I know a lot of people that have done it. Don’t worry too much about it. Just try to do some things that you like to do (playing videos games, listening to music, hanging out with your family/girlfriend) and try to remind yourself that everything is fine. It seems like it’s something that should pass over soon. If it doesn’t, then it might be something to worry about.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help (mentally)
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

You’re just depressed…

Lel I get depressed alot. But only for short periods so I don’t care. I just reassure myself it’s puberty, if it isn’t I don’t care aslong as I’m fooling myself.

Good thing I’m a usually happy person otherwise I would /cut.

Read full topic

item.description:

Probably puberty?
Take anti-depressants…

item.title: I need help (mentally)
item.dc:creator: @BlackThursday BlackThursday
item.description:
@BlackThursday wrote:

GTFO

TheBeanie:

Sometimes when im bored and when im lying in bed in the morning i feel like its like Why the fuck am i here What is the point of this… growing up doing the ritual of life seems boring to me lol

Part of being a teenager mate, sometimes life sucks. I had a low period during freshman year, I thought it was all shit. It’ll get better with time. Take Algas advice, talk it out with your friends/girlfriend.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help (mentally)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Cognition. Negative thoughts feed negative emotions which feed further negative thoughts and so on. Perhaps coupled with mild stress/anxiety which you don’t even know you have?

Look into Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (not that I am suggesting you need a therapist, but the ideas are something everyone can use).

Read full topic

item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

maybe someone wants you to feel bad, keep doing what your doing, maybe talk it out like algas said, and just take a few risks? maybe this is happening because your like is too good? maybe you need to spice it up a bit?

well i cbaed reading it all but i think you should have a party, when ever i am feeling down i will probs go to a football match then from there mabe have a drink with my mates hang out, then probs go to a house party
[/quote]
yeah but it helps alot with your self asteam…

That’d only be temporarily.[/quote]

item.title: I need help (mentally)
item.dc:creator: @Algas Algas
item.description:
@Algas wrote:

If you have amazing grilfriend and good friends maybe you should try talking to them. My friend used to have same kind of depression that you apparently have. He talked about his situation and now he is feeling much better. Try not to solve your “problems” alone!

Read full topic
